comments:
I created a SSH connection, right clicked on a folder, selected "Create Remote Project".

Now I switch to the newly-created remote project and edit a file. When I save the file I see a few error messages in the "PDE Error Log". Usually two come up at the same time.

first, "Error refreshing remote edit project" --> 

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: F/..., does not match outer scope rule: L/...
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:122)
...

followed by

"Internal Error"

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: F/..., does not match outer scope rule: L/...
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:122)
...


Eclipse version is 3.2.1 and 3.3M5 (tried both, both fail), RSE version is 1.0.1

This is a known, we have a plan item to fix it for 2.0

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 170916 ***
Any chance to short-term fix this in 1.0.1 ?

We need to focus on API things right now, and since this is an implementation thing not touching API's we probably won't get to it before RSE 2.0 M6.

If you need it earlier - what about stepping up and helping yourself?

If you read bug 170916 you'll see that it looks like the proper solution for now is to use IFileService (without cache) instead of IRemoteFileSubSystem.
